DataElement.preferredName: Prior Or Synchronous Malignant Neoplasm Other Anatomic Site Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the anatomic site of another prior or synchronous malignancy not previously mentioned or specified.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Or Synchronous Malignant Neoplasm Other Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Occurring at the same time or rate._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Named locations of or within the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Occurring at the same time or rate.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Occurring at the same time or rate.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Body tissue, region, surface, cavity, fluid, organ, or collection of organs.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.
